Alaska.mail_request_instructions: Request or fill out an absentee ballot application and send it to your local Absentee Office.
Alaska.in_person_request_instructions: Visit an early/in-person absentee voting location starting 15 days before the election.
Alaska.ballot_delivery: Postmarked or delivered by election day.

Alabama.mail_instructions:
Request or fill out a ballot application and send it/take it to your local election manager. You'll need to provide:

  • your name
  • home address
  • mailing address
  • photo ID
  • your signature
Alabama.in_person_request_instructions: Delivered to your local election manager by 5 p.m. the day before te election.
Alabama.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're

  • out of the country
  • ill
  • working a 10-hour shift
  • caring for a family member who's confined to their home
  • incarcerated (though not if you've been convicted of a felony)

Arkansas.mail_instructions: Request or download an absentee ballot application from your County Clerk.
Arkansas.in_person_request_instructions: Deliver your absentee ballot application by the day before the election.
Arkansas.ballot_delivery: In person: Before election day. By mail: Received by 7:30 p.m. on election day.
Arkansas.requirements:
To vote absentee, you must:

  • be unable to get to your polling site
  • ill
  • have a physical disability
  • indicate if you'll be picking you your ballot in person, by mail, or bearer (i.e. someone else is getting it for you)

Arizona.mail_instructions: Sign up online or contact your County Recorder to get added to AZ's "permanent early voting list".
Arizona.in_person_request_instructions: You can vote early in person starting 27 days before the election at an early voting location. Learn more about how and where.
Arizona.ballot_delivery: Election day. You can return ballots to your , any voting location, or any designated ballot return box.

California.mail_instructions: Fill out a vote-by-mail application (or use the one that comes in your voter guide) and return it to your local elections office.
California.mail_request_deadline: 7 days before the election. If you miss this deadline, you can still apply in person. Some counties even let you apply by phone!
California.in_person_request_instructions: Some counties offer in-person early voting. Find out if you can vote early.
California.ballot_delivery: Postmarked or returned in person by election day.

Colorado.types: CO has a vote-by-mail system, in which ballots are automatically mailed to registered voters. You can also vote in person.
Colorado.mail_instructions: Every voter receives a mail ballot sent to the mailing address you listed when you registered.
Colorado.mail_request_deadline: You don't need to request a by-mail ballot in CO. They'll send it as long as youre registered.
Colorado.in_person_request_instructions: You can drop off your ballot in person before the election. Get in touch with your county clerk to learn where and when.
Colorado.ballot_delivery: Your county clerk must receive your ballot by 7 p.m. on election day.

Connecticut.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and send it to your town clerk.
Connecticut.mail_request_deadline: The CT Secretary of State isn't specific, but the state needs to process your application, send you a ballot, and receive your filled out ballot. Give yourself at least 10 days.
Connecticut.in_person_request_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and deliver it to your town clerk.
Connecticut.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're:

  • Out of town on election day
  • ill
  • celebrating a religious occasion that prevents you from voting
  • physically incapable of getting to the polling place

Delaware.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and return it to your local Department of Elections.
Delaware.mail_request_deadline: Deleware stops issuing absentee ballots the day before the election. We recommend getting your ballot request in at least 10 days early.
Delaware.in_person_request_instructions: Same as by mail: Fill out an absentee ballot application and bring it to your local Department of Elections.
Delaware.ballot_delivery: The last day to deliver an absentee ballot by hand is 12 days before the election. Your mailed ballot has to be in by the time the polls close on election day.
Delaware.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're:

  • working
  • away at school
  • ill
  • on vacation
  • physically unable to get to the polls
  • celebrating a religious occasion that prevents you from voting

Florida.types: Florida has vote-by-mail and early voting.
Florida.mail_instructions: Download or request a vote-by-mail application from your county Supervisor of Elections and then send it back.
Florida.in_person_request_instructions: As long as you're registered, you can vote early in person at an early voting site.
Florida.ballot_delivery:
• By-mail ballots must be returned by 7 p.m. on election day
  • In person early voting happens between the 10th and 3rd days before an election. The period may be longer in your area; check with your county Supervisor of Elections

Georgia.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and mail/email/take it back to your local County Board of Registrar's Office.
Georgia.mail_request_deadline: The GA Secretary of State doesn't specify, but leave enough time to submit your application, receive your ballot, and send it back. We recommend at least 10 days before the election.
Georgia.in_person_request_instructions: During the early voting period, you can vote at one of these early vote locations. The early voting period starts 4 Mondays before the election and ends the Friday before election day. You'll fill out an absentee ballot at the early vote location.

Hawaii.types: Hawaii has a vote-by-mail system, in which ballots are automatically mailed to registered voters.
Hawaii.mail_instructions: Your local election clerk will mail you a ballot and an envelope in which to return it.
Hawaii.in_person_request_instructions: You can register and vote early at a voter service center starting 10 days before the election.

Iowa.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and mail/email/fax/take it to your county auditor.
Iowa.mail_request_deadline:
If requesting by mail:

  • For the general election: 10 days before
  • For other elections: 11 days before

If requesting by email or fax, submit your application the Monday before an election.
Iowa.in_person_request_instructions: Starting 29 days before an election, you can vote at your county auditor's office until the day before an election.
Iowa.ballot_delivery: By the time the polls close on election day.

Idaho.mail_instructions: Fill out this absentee ballot application and send it to your county clerk
Idaho.in_person_request_instructions: You can cast an early vote at an "absent elector's polling place" (ask your county clerk where this is) until 5 p.m. on the Friday before an election. The beginning of this early voting period seems to vary by county; check with your local clerk for specifics.
